fee.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: an amount of money that you pay to do something or that you pay to a professional person for their work
fee.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: You can use the gym and pool for a fee of £35 a month.
fee.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: small/low
Some companies will sell the items for you, for a small fee.
high/large/big
The school fees are extremely high.
a hefty/fat fee
Customers are being charged a hefty fee for their telephone service.
an annual/a monthly fee
An annual fee of £150 has been introduced.
an entrance/entry fee
The gallery charges an entrance fee.
a membership fee
The gym’s yearly membership fee is £250.
a subscription fee
You can pay the subscription fee by cheque.
school/college/university fees
She paid for her college fees by taking a part-time job as a waitress.
tuition fees
Many universities now charge tuition fees for these courses.
doctor’s/lawyer’s/accountant’s etc fees
We need to find the money for the doctor’s fees somehow.
legal/medical fees
She received £300 compensation after legal fees had been deducted.
a flat/fixed/set fee
You pay a flat fee for all the services that are provided.
a booking fee
Tickets for the concert are £45, plus a booking fee.
a cancellation fee
A 10% cancellation fee will be charged if the booking is cancelled.
a licence fee
The licence fee is set to rise again.
charge a fee
The accountant charged a big fee for his services.
pay a fee
You have to pay a small fee to rent a locker.
fee.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: an amount of money paid to a professional person or organization for their services
fee.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: If you want help selecting a policy, you might want to use an insurance adviser who charges a fee, but earns no commission.
The bank does not charge an arrangement fee for the loan.
Cable TV subscribers pay a monthly fee for the service.
fee.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: an amount of money paid to an author, musician etc for a book, piece of music etc that they have written
fee.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: The publisher canceled publication and refused to pay the author a promised $900,000 fee.
